div.p: Governor Whitmer has closed school for the rest of the 2019-2020 school year. We have provided a Instructional Resource page to help during this time.

div.div: Holton Elementary - Remote Learning Plan Letter to Families

span.a: PDF File Holton Elementary - Remote Learning Plan Letter to families
PDF File Incident with Virtual Class

div.div: COVID -19 Continued Learning Plan - Community Communication 4-15-20

div.p: Greetings Holton Families! Holton Public Schools have completed our Remote Learning Plan. It is now posted to our website. Specific details about your child's learning will be shared by building principals and teachers. We plan to implement our plan on Monday, April 20 and will provide support for the remainder of the school year. It may be necessary to modify our plan as we move forward. We will work hard to keep everyone as informed as possible of those changes. More than anything, we want to help support our families to be safe and well during this time. Our teachers are eager to check in on our students and engage them in learning! Should you have any questions, contact Mr. Carlson or Mrs. Byrnes. Stay safe and healthy!

span.a: PDF File COVID -19 Continued Learning Plan - Community Communication

div.p: *If you want dinner added, please use the link for dinner signup
*If you want breakfast and lunch, please see the link below. You do not have to signup again if you already have breakfast and lunch delivery.
*This is for ALL of our families with children 0-18 years old or students with special needs to age 26

span.a: PDF File Grab and Go Meals Flyer 4-9-20

div.p: The Holton Public Schools’ community will foster a safe and respectful educational environment focused on life-long learning, college, career, and work place success, and the continuous growth of all stakeholders toward academic excellence.
